item.title: Projects
item.description:
crystvis-js

GitHub Documentation

Created for my computational science work, it’s a renderer for molecule and crystal structures in the browser using Three.js. It supports reading XYX, CIF, CELL and MAGRES formats, and allows plotting some additional visualization elements like ellipsoids or isosurfaces.

compyrtment

GitHub

Python package providing some efficient and simple simulations of compartment models of dynamical systems, supporting both deterministic ODE solutions and the stochastic Gillespie algorithm. Originally developed in 2020 to help with epidemiological research during the COVID pandemic; was used for this paper.

item.title: About
item.description:
About Me

I’m Simone Sturniolo. I’m a software developer working in London. I got a PhD in physics back in Italy, at the University of Pavia, and then worked for a long time as computational scientist, writing code to help solve problems of atomic structure in solid matter. Now I’m working at a start-up developing a new biomedical device.

What I Do

In my personal projects I usually experiment for fun with building interesting things or exploring scientific ideas in domains like dynamical systems. I also occasionally develop games and may do some creative writing.
